str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Or Moses, or Mouses of Hebrew origin; Moseus, Moses, or Mouses, the Hebrew lawgiver.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Original, primitive, ancient. From arche; original or primeval.
From genos; a generation; by implication, an age.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To read, know again, know certainly, recognize, discern. From ana and ginosko; to know again, i.e. to read.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
